subNodes.conversationText: root

Ah. Just what we were looking for. [Ianth leafs through the portfolio quickly, her face growing more and more perplexed.] How strange!||***ga_jump-->String::freus_ianth_wp String::ianth Float::0 ***ga_jump-->String::freus_vroman_wp String::vroman Float::0 ***ga_destroy-->String::kill_zhent1 Int::0 Float::0 ***ga_destroy-->String::kill_zhent2 Int::0 Float::0 ***ga_destroy-->String::kill_zhent3 Int::0 Float::0 ***ga_destroy-->String::kill_zhent4 Int::0 Float::0 ***ga_destroy-->String::kill_zhent5 Int::0 Float::0 ***ga_destroy-->String::kill_zhent6 Int::0 Float::0 ***ga_destroy-->String::beastobane Int::0 Float::0 ***ga_destroy-->String::portfolio_glow Int::0 Float::0 ***gc_is_in_combat-->NOT::True String::$PC_SPEAKER ***gc_dead-->NOT::True String::ianth ***gc_dead-->NOT::True String::vroman ||
What is it?
It seems as if the Zhentarim are spread out throughout the Backlands and Sunset Vale.  Normally, this would be terrible news.
Indeed. I hope this cloud comes with one Hells of a silver lining.
It does.  It seems as if the Zhents have lost Darkhold.
What does this mean?
Indeed, what does it mean?  Darkhold has been the bastion of the Zhentarim in western Faerun for years.  And now their forces are scattered over one hundred miles of land.
The Zhents here must have had no direct interest in Drawn Swords, though I wonder if they weren't scouting out a new, temporary base of operations in these woods.
Lost Darkhold!  Unbelievable!
Interesting indeed.  Let me take a look at the portfolio.

I am curious about this myself.  Corm Orp is close to Darkhold, and if Darkhold is lost to the Zhentarim, it will surely affect the town in one way or another.||***ga_jump-->String::freus_gossam_wp    String::gossam    Float::0    ***gc_comp_remove-->NOT::False    String::gossam    ||

[Ianth hands you the portfolio.] Now that we have found what we needed to find, we ought to tell Hamfast back in Drawn Swords. This place still isn't safe.|***ga_create_obj-->String::C String::marcellus String::marcellus_wp1 Int::0 String:: Float::0 |

|***ga_give_xp-->Int::200    Int::0    ***ga_journal-->String::Q_MANFRED    Int::20    Int::0    Int::0    Int::0    ***ga_create_obj-->String::C    String::teurneia    String::teurneia_wp1    Int::0    String::    Float::0    ***ga_create_obj-->String::C    String::belforet    String::belforet_wp1    Int::0    String::    Float::0    ***ga_local_int-->String::portfolio_int    String::1    String::ianth    |

Safe? Not if you're here. [Surveying the carnage.] It appears you've done my job for me--and then some.|***ga_face_target-->String::$PC_SPEAKER String::marcellus Int::0 ***ga_face_target-->String::ianth String::marcellus Int::0 ***ga_face_target-->String::vroman String::marcellus Int::0 ***ga_face_target-->String::gossam String::marcellus Int::0 |
[Ianth speaks shakily; her face is pale.] M--Marcellus?
The same.  Still pursuing me, Knight?
Pursue--no!  But--the Zhentarim?  Are you working for them?

Yes. Does it bother you that I am working for the Zhentarim? You've done them a favor, you know: Freusen Esk, the man you just killed, secretly worshipped Cyric, and was conspiring with other Cyricists. I was to kill him; I do not begrudge you the office, as I'm sure I'll still get paid.
What is going on here, Ianth?  Who is this?
Marcellus is--was--a mercenary in the employ of my father.  But now he is working for the forces of Zhentil Keep.  Gods!
"A mercenary in the employ of my father"--If only that were all there was to the story. That it isn't can't be blamed on me.
So this is the Sune-worshipping madwoman, Marcellus?
[Blushing furiously.] Madwoman? Is that the report you make of me? Perhaps it is true. As I look on what you have become, I begin to doubt what I once felt.
[Blushing himself, but with anger.] It is about time you begin doubting that. It has always been more your problem than mine.
Enough!  I do not know what cruelty you have put Ianth through, but you shan't put her through any more in my presence.|***ga_global_int-->String::sympathetic    String::++    |
I insist that you leave us now, Marcellus--or I will run you through myself.
No, <FirstName>, do not interfere.
[Marcellus makes a dismissive gesture, and looks you up and down.]
Like sticks to like, I see.  Sisters-in-arms, I take it?|***gc_is_female-->NOT::False    |
Nay, spinsters-in-arms.
In any case, it is time for us to depart. Come, Teurneia and Belforet. Ianth and her friends have won this battle.
Which battle, though?

|***ga_move_exit-->Int::3    Int::0    String::    String::marcellus    ***ga_move_exit-->Int::3    Int::0    String::    String::teurneia    ***ga_move_exit-->Int::3    Int::0    String::    String::belforet    |
[Ianth turns to you. She is shaking, almost imperceptibly.] You are curious about this, I know. But we need to get back to Drawn Swords, and I do not wish to discuss this--right now.
But Ianth--
You are not a fool, <FirstName>.  You can come to your own conclusions for now.  Onward.  There is much we need to discuss with Hamfast.
Very well.  Let us go.

[As you turn to go, Vroman whispers to you.] That was capital! The Sunite paladin has a curious past with this Zhentarim mercenary. I'd be a fool myself if I didn't see that there were some sparks there--the kind that start the worst fires, to be sure, but--
Hush, Vroman!|***ga_destroy-->String::z_portfolio    Int::0    Float::0    |
Indeed.  But let us go to Drawn Swords.|***ga_destroy-->String::z_portfolio    Int::0    Float::0    |

You have chosen your escort well.  He is handsome, and of good height and comportment.  I would have expected no less.|***gc_check_stats-->NOT::False    Int::5    Int::14    ***gc_check_race_pc-->NOT::True    String::1    ***gc_check_race_pc-->NOT::True    String::3    ***gc_check_race_pc-->NOT::True    String::5    ***gc_check_race_pc-->NOT::True    String::6    |

What is the meaning of this ugly little thing? Don't tell me your father could not afford to buy you a whole bodyguard.|***gc_check_race_pc-->NOT::False String::1 ***gc_check_race_pc-->NOT::False String::3 ***gc_check_race_pc-->NOT::False String::5 |
One would think a paladin of Sune would have more discernment than to travel with such a plain-looking fellow on her arm.
[Say nothing.]
[Ianth pales, and her jaw clenches. She shoots you an anxious, involuntary glance.]
Who are you? I don't believe we know each other.
[Say nothing.]
Let me take a look at those documents myself, Ianth.
[Still reading.] In a moment! This is very unusual.
There are still enemies about.
